summary: @villan3lle that bit where bran says he’s almost a man reminded me of the part in HP when one the centaurs that surround Harry...
body: @villan3lle that bit where bran says he’s almost a man reminded me of the part in HP when one the centaurs that surround Harry say he’s almost a man. Most HP fans interpreted that as foreshadowing for Sirius’s death and Harry’s eventual coming of age from boy to young man. in ootp. So I’m wondering if Bran saying something similar means something similar to Bran’s development?

reblog.comment: @villan3lle that bit where bran says he’s almost a man reminded me of the part in HP when one the centaurs that surround Harry say he’s almost a man. body:
Keeping up with the Starks

Arya : I’ve done a lot of dumb stuff😎

Rickon : I suggested the dumb stuff😇

Bran : I witnessed the dumb stuff🙂

Robb : I recorded the dumb stuff🤩

Jon : I joined you in the dumb stuff😆

Theon : I enjoyed the dumb stuff😂

Sansa : I TRIED TO STOP YOU FROM DOING THE DUMB STUFF !! 🤬

Bonus-

Gendry : What did I get myself into!? Never doing the “ I’m dumb stuff, do me” joke with Arya 😳🤭

title: Reminder.
body:
Bran suffered plenty because of Jaime’s actions. He should have a say whether this man gets a pass or not. He’s one of the few people who actually has a legitimate complaint against him (Danerice can go suck Drogon’s dick, she has no reason to be upset).

However, the narrative beauty of who gets to save Jaime’s arse in 8x2 should be Sansa. It was because of Cat’s promise that Jaime started his redemption journey (and in my opinion, redemption is NEVER over), such that should be the reason why he gets ultimately saved. Therefore, Sansa.

If this happens, Tyrion can go suck some dick too. He BROKE the promise he made to Cat. It was the kingslayer, oathbreaker, the man without honour, that actually fulfilled Cat’s promise of helping Sansa, while Tyrion just imprisoned her even more so instead.

summary: Maybe this is just me, but I honestly think Bran is showing more emotion this season. Although his reaction was subtle, he was...
question: Maybe this is just me, but I honestly think Bran is showing more emotion this season. Although his reaction was subtle, he was clearly happy to be reunited with his adopted brother Jon and slyly smirked that Jon was all teary-eyed over the fact his little brother was now a man. Also, him smirking at he parked himself in the snow to wait for his "old friend" aka Jaime was such a snarky teenage thing to do. He really seems to have fun trolling people in his freaky Three-Eyed-Raven way.
answer: I noticed. It’s a subtle improvement from last season but I miss Isaac’s acting. In his recent interview he said Bran is now more of the Night King’s ancient nemesis than Bran Stark and that is so sad and tragic but the show isn’t interested in examining that

reblog.comment: I noticed. It’s a subtle improvement from last season but I miss Isaac’s acting. In his recent interview he said Bran is now more of the Night King’s ancient nemesis than Bran Stark and that is so sad and tragic but the show isn’t interested in examining that

summary: bran stark is the key to winning
title: bran stark is the key to winning
body: isaac hempstead wright said that bran is now the three eyed raven who is the ancient nemesis of the night king. the actor who plays the night king said he was searching for someone and that person can only be bran. dany’s dragonfire had no effect on the night king, he killed one of her dragons and raised it from the dead. he didn’t bother to raise the previous three eyed raven from the dead and use the magic he possessed. he killed him and continued pursuing bran because bran is the only person who can defeat him. daenerys and jon are not part of the equation, they don’t have what it takes to take out the night king but bran did the moment he woke up from his coma

tags: not sure i agree with taking it quite as far as the AU does
but connecting it to the ADWD prologue is A++
title: A Genuinely Terrifying Patchface Theory
excerpt: You may already be familiar with Patchface. He was a slave boy from Volantis, who served as a fool, and was bought his freedom by Steffon Baratheon, father of Robert, Stannis, and Renly. He was a t…
description:
I’m always starved for quality Bran meta and this is a great read. I was initially searching for some discussion on Patchface and his Under the Sea song. Turns out Patchface and Bran have quite a number of connected threads. The meta is organized nicely into ten sections and discusses greenseers, dreams from the Bloodraven, and warging with extensive book quotes. It also pulls in quite a bit of the ADWD prologue, which has been nagging at me all month. And offers a pretty solid explanation for why Melisandre is terrified of Patchface.

I’m still wondering where Melisandre will show up in S8. Specifically, how great are the odds that she’ll meet Bran?

blog.name: alienscorpion
blog.title: That’s All
blog.description:
"If nothing really matters, then anything can matter."

Sara, 27. Exasperatingly INFP, Gryffindor with a Hero Complex, Peter Pan Syndrome and more than a touch of madness. Aspiring (Amateur) Author, Master Procrastinator, The Inventor Of Daydreams. I waste time in my sparetime and I pee with my headseats on. Fantasy/Sci-fi/Horror/Marvel/DC fan. Also a fan of Human Rights, Equality and that pesky pipe dream called Universal Peace. Warning: I can be a real downer.

summary:
Every breath you take
Every move you make...
I’ll be watching you.
This is one of those spoiler-not spoilers for the first...
body:
Every breath you take

Every move you make…

I’ll be watching you.

This is one of those spoiler-not spoilers for the first episode of game of thrones, and this was the biggest thing I took away from the first episode is Bran just casually creeping on everyone.
